idea-plugin.name: Shutdown Tasks
idea-plugin.description:
Shutdown Tasks

Execute run configurations automatically when closing a project or IDE.

Features

  • Automated Shutdown Scripts: Run cleanup scripts, deployment tasks, or any configured run configuration on project close
  • Synchronous mode: Wait for tasks to complete with configurable timeout (1-300 seconds per task)
  • Task Management: Add, remove, edit and reorder tasks with an intuitive UI (Settings → Tools → Shutdown Tasks)
  • Visual Feedback: Progress dialog shows current task execution and elapsed time

Important

⚠️ Please note that “Shell Script” tasks must not have “Execute in the terminal” selected.

Use Cases

  • Run cleanup scripts to remove temporary files
  • Execute deployment or build tasks before closing
  • Stop development servers or background processes
  • Commit or push code automatically
  • Archive or backup project files

Configuration

Configure shutdown tasks in Settings (Preferences) → Tools → Shutdown Tasks

Important Notes

  • Synchronous mode: Tasks will wait for the configured timeout duration. For best performance, keep tasks short as possible.
  • Task execution: Tasks are executed in the order they appear in the list
  • Cancellation: You can cancel execution at any time
